page.title: 01OUR BLOCK
page.content: Our unit is situated SW of Crewe Town Centre. Even areas close to the town are rural in character, having well-matured trees in abundance. Housing developments are pleasantly designed and varied. There is a predominance of farming and arable land. The village communities are Wistaston, Shavington, Rope, Basford and Hough. The village of Shavington is not the largest settlement but its recorded history dates back to the original Domesday Book, when it was known as Santune. It is a true community having a variety of local shops, a Post Office, a Church and a Chapel. The residents have a strong community spirit. The block is an extremely pleasant one; residents take pride in their houses and gardens and it is therefore a sought-after area, begirt with pretty countryside.
